website_summaries.verdict: A good choice if pet hair and dust cleanup are your top priorities, as its 3 brushes pick up what other models miss.
pros: Offers a good balance of Roomba features
Works with Amazon Alexa or Google Assistant via the free app so you can control it from anywhere
Runs up to 90 minutes on a single charge
cons: Some reported it needs "supervision," as it sometimes misses entire rooms or gets lost

website_summaries.verdict: This quintessential robot vacuum from iRobot is a great choice for small spaces and has many smart features.
pros: A quiet robotic vacuum that picks up everything from crumbs to pet hair
It's easy to turn the Roomba on and leave it to it work
Can be controlled with the iRobot HOME app or by voice with Alexa
cons: Has a tendency to wander aimlessly
Customers recommend not watching the vacuum and trusting it to get the job done

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good with some flaws
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good. I've been having issues with it vacuuming all rooms on the first floor. Sometimes it only does the office and hallway, the first day it did those plus my kitchen and living room. So it's hit or miss if it will vacuum every room, and if I'm not home I'll never know where it went. Also when i hit the button on top of it to go back to the dock, it doesn't. Just flashes and keeps vacuuming. I'll guess I'll keep it, but I have to babysit it occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Z

customer_reviews.title: Aimless Wanderer
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely despise this product. Plug it in, charge it, and then the frustration begins. Connecting to WiFi was a struggle in itself. Then watching it bounce around aimlessly in a small quadrant of my living room was beyond frustrating. It possibly ran over the same spot 50 times but never made it to the hallway. Traces of dirt still remain. We're taking about a 300 sqft living room. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: BFA21

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: I received it today, so far so good. It was very easy and quick to set it up with wifi. I used to have the model 655 which i love cause of the suction power, this model(675) is not as powerful as the 655 but definitely is less noisy. I’m very pleased so far and I found the wifi connection very convenient
customer_reviews.author: Katerine Rosendo

customer_reviews.title: Time saving!
customer_reviews.text: This little machine is very powerful and saves me so much time. I have such a floor area and didn't want to spend all day sweeping. It really does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Sent back after 3 weeks. Get stuck too often. Used one sent 2nd time around
customer_reviews.text: With this you get what you pay for. When it works it works well but you have to be there to watch the entire time it cleans. Attached are some photos of where it is been stuck, and the battery dies. Have had a few weeks and it is not worth it. Loved the concept of the device just not this one. 2nd review. This just gets worse... ordered again to try to get the correct item and it was used! Picture included. I ordered a new one and they repackaged. This is unacceptable
customer_reviews.author: JLB

customer_reviews.title: Not working right
customer_reviews.text: It is having problems docking. When it gets to the dock. It seems to throw it back and. Forth. And sometimes does not onnect to charge
customer_reviews.author: colleen huddleston

customer_reviews.title: Love my new maid!
customer_reviews.text: This rumba is amazing. We have 4 pets inside our house and it was a daily struggle to keep up with all the dog hair. This has saved me a lot of time, and our floors looks great, no more left over dog hair. I would highly recommend this item to anyone with inside pets.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M.

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first robot vacuum cleaner. I did major research and the iRobot roomba 675 won. The other brands just didn't come close. While researching, I looked for replacement parts, again the iRobot roomba 675 won. I have had my robot "Rosie" for 2 weeks now. My home is 3800sqft and Rosie does a great job. She doesn't get everywhere, however she gets 95 percent and that takes a big load off of me! I did have to get a set of virtual walls because my home is so big. The iRobot roomba 675 is a good buy in my book. Just remember, it is a machine and doesn't clean like you would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the ideal solution...
customer_reviews.text: This product wanders randomly through your house with no learning capability. It gets stuck under tables or in one room for long periods of time. Many of the rooms in our house it can never access because it doesn't have an eye sensor to detect linear wall boundary. It just randomly turns when it hits a wall or object. I would purchase a more costly model with the learning / mapping technology but they are just too expensive. I'll just hire a maid...
customer_reviews.author: Huckleberry

customer_reviews.title: ♡ it
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it says it is going to do. Was super easy to program and just let it go. It re docks itself, cleans my floors (about 900 square feet with 2 carpeted areas, linoleum, and hardwood), and while it is a little noisy it isn't enough to wake me up (I programmed it to clean at midnight).
customer_reviews.author: Cari A.

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to sweep up after this shabby vac.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement to my original roomba. Which is now 9 years old. It's in no way of the same quality. It doesn't get in the corners. The roller and brush are flimsy, sparse and very cheaply made by comparison. Leaves lots of debris on floors.
customer_reviews.author: kz

customer_reviews.title: Love my Roomba
customer_reviews.text: It works great I have it scheduled to clean every workday morning at 4:00 and weekends at 8:00. If you have a dog that sheds make sure you clean the brushes frequently. I bought a refill kit that came with a brush cleaner and razor blade that works great to help clean the brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M B

customer_reviews.title: This Roomba is well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: The Roomba 675 is a great product it cleans our floors better than our regular vacuum. The reason I bought it was dog hair that our 100 lb dog sheds and it has done a great job, in fact it is doing a better than I expected. I’m confused by the few negative reviews I read now that we have one. It is not loud at all yes you can hear it, but it has to make some noise, it has gotten stuck but if you make sure you clean wires off the ground and remove other little objects that can get caught in the brush you will be fine. I highly recommend the Roomba 675!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure if we got a broken product or if the product just sucks. It’s supposed to run for up to 90 mins and then dock itself. Ours ran for about 7 minutes and then announced an error. We cleared the error and restarted, and about 5 mins later it reported the same error. This happened over and over until we had to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: No Connection whatsoever.
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has been selling on Amazon for 10 years, this will be the first time I'll be leaving a negative review. The item did not come with any instructions on how to set up the Robot with your phone. I had to google and no matter which option I followed, it just won't connect with my phone. I get to setting where it says "Connect Romba to Wi-fi and then cme back to the iRobot." I did it million times and it's just stuck on that page. I even tried 2.4g network instead of 5g and it just won't work. Never have I gotten frustrated with such an item before.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Get a Deebot instead.
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Decided to upgrade from our broken Deebot. Thicker than Deebot, got stuck under furniture. Super small collecting basket, got full well before it was done cleaning. (Pet hair)Only one side brush, very inefficient. Got stuck in places where the deebot didn’t and had constant unexplained errors. I’m sure the errors were probably a factory defect but with all the other shortfalls we decided to just return it and get another deebot, which was also less money. Very disappointed. I thought we were stepping up but it turns out we were stepping down
customer_reviews.author: beau

customer_reviews.title: Best ever for pet hair
customer_reviews.text: Use every day for cat hair, litter, and general dust. Love that it goes under my bed, coffee table, and dining room table. It also glides over area rugs and goes on to clean porcelain floors. Works well on all of my carpeted rooms. It is such a time saver and the floors are always clean. Can’t live without it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Marucci

customer_reviews.title: ITS THE BEST BUY I EVER MADE.
customer_reviews.text: Yes. I have a dog. It cleans dog hair very well. I bought this cute er Monday at $200. What a deal!. I would buy another. It is nice to sit on the couch and watch it vacuum while I relax. I do direct it with my feet to the bedroom. It does my whole apartment. Under my coffee table, couch and chairs. It's so nice not to pull out my big old vacuum cleaner. I've told my niece to buy my sister one. What a great XMas present. I LOVE IT!!!!!!! 10 stars.
customer_reviews.author: sharon dworschak

customer_reviews.title: Great for pet hair!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great product! Easy to use, cleans very well and entertaining all at the same time. We have a house full of cats and dogs and I’m impressed by the ability to collect animal hair efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Roboto

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend NOT buying this vacuum!!!! It is not worth the money at all. The idea behind it is great and to be honest it vacuums really well.....however it rarely vacuums for longer than 10 minutes before it is stuck under our couch or one of our lazy boys. It actually forces itself under the furniture so hard it takes a bit just to get it out. Its way too loud to use while we are home so we turn it on when we leave and always come back to a stuck Roomba and dirty floors. If there was a unit that would fix this issue I would be all about it but this one is not it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tony L

customer_reviews.title: After 1 mth docked 3x
customer_reviews.text: So they took out the smart features that originally came when it was released. Those features only available for newer versions. Watching it, it immediately goes to areas it got “stuck”. Had it for a month has only completed or docked it’s self 3 times.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Us!
customer_reviews.text: My husband got me this for Christmas and I love it! It is a bit loud, but we only have tile and wood flooring so I’m sure that’s a contributing factor. We have dark wood floors and this model has no issues with it like the older models. We did have a little trouble getting it to find the WiFi network to be able to use the app, but after a few tries with pairing, we got it. We have a 1750 sq ft house, single story, and could do the whole house on one charge before going back to its base.
customer_reviews.author: sara

customer_reviews.title: Big problem docking
customer_reviews.text: This is driving me crazy. The job is finished, it tries to dock maybe once or twice but fails so off it goes again not to return. I have tried placing it on the dock. It sits for a second then off it goes again. My husband has tried securing the base several different ways but no luck. Im so mad right now I was ready to throw it out the window. Also very loud so there is no way to talk during its cleaning and free flowing sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Exjetmachina

customer_reviews.title: Unless you have a house with hard wood floors and no furniture, don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it 0 stars I would. I had to pick it up every five minutes because it would either say it was stuck or on edge of cliff, and when I would go to it it would be in the middle of the floor around nothing or beside the wall. Oh and if you have carpet don’t bother it doesn’t pick anything up. And it also can’t find its way back to the docking station half the time. And it looses WiFi connectivity with the app a lot. I had this thing for 24hrs and I’m already sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B.

customer_reviews.title: The roomba wishes it was an ECOVACS
customer_reviews.text: This “vacuum” is a joke. You’d think the originator of robot vacuums would be the best but I’ve now bought and returned 4, 1 being this one. It is louder than any other brand, picks up the least and has zero organization or room pattern. ECOVACS deebot ended up being a life saver. Don’t waste your time with anything roomba 🤮
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Super noisy,  and no robotic skills
customer_reviews.text: I have tried already 5 other brands, this is the worst robotic vacuum, maybe I should say a vacuum with no robotic skills. First of all, connecting to the network is way old fashion it takes very longtime to connect it. It has same noise level as a small power generator. You cannot hear almost your sound when you're talking. It just goes straight and hits an obstacle and change its direction randomly. So it leaves many spots uncleaned. It goes into a room and it cannot find the way out. Also the dust cabin is wide open and smallest in the market. Stay away from this brand. It is useless and a return
customer_reviews.author: T. Sen

customer_reviews.title: It really works!!  The roomba 675 is a work horse!!
customer_reviews.text: This roomba is great. I have a bible study each week and all the ladies remarked on how good my hardwood floors looked. They said my floors looked shiner every week. I thought they we looking better. But since they said that. I know they are!!! It took Rhoda about 10 days to learn my house. The air is cleaner now. I love my roomba! My floors looked so good, that my friend bought one for herself and she loves it. It is great on carpet also. I only have carpet in one room.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Less than a year in showing age
customer_reviews.text: We have a German Shepard who,leaves hair everywhere. "Robo" helps in keeping the hair at bay. But within a couple of months stopped returning to the charger, hard to make charge even after cleaning the charging contacts. Now cannot get to connect to WiFi. Overall happy, but can see having to replace every 2 years or so. I guess that since it runs every day that is almost acceptable. Before we had a no name robot vac. Lasted about 5 months cost close to the same, so overall the Roomba unit is better.
customer_reviews.author: Bigflip

customer_reviews.title: love my drunken roomba
customer_reviews.text: She doesn't go systematically like my sisters. She kind of willy nillys around the house, but it always gets everywhere. she also fails to return home a lot, and just sort of passes out in the middle of the room, thus her drunken reputation. but my floors have never looked so good!!!! worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you don't get a refurbished model when you pay the price for a new one.
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new model and when we opened it up it looked like it was refurbished. A lot of scratching along the front bumper and we could see lent/hair/dist on the bottom side of this machine. When we picked it up a chunk of lent fell out of it. Definitely not new and was very disappointed hoping to exchange it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Posladek

customer_reviews.title: Clean but forgetful
customer_reviews.text: I have a love hate relationship with this iRobot. First off, it does clean and it’s kind of cool. I’ve never had one before. That said, it keeps getting stuck in the same spot. I thought It wa supposed to be smart- nope not at all. The charging mechanism isn’t great either and sits in the charging station and appears to charge indicated by the green light but within minutes, it turns off. Does it clean? Yes. But it does need me to babsysit while it does or it will get lost or stuck in the same spots - every single time.
customer_reviews.author: Food 🥦Fit Mom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: It is constantly getting stuck. I have to run it when I’m home so I can babysit it because it is always getting stuck. A lot of times the battery runs out before it gets all of my floor because it seems to wander aimlessly and vacuum the same spaces over and over while completely missing other areas. I bought this approximately three months ago and it’s already telling me to replace the brushes, which are not cheap at $50. Not even sure I want to replace the brushes now. Doesn’t seem worth it. Disappointing. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love Chloe (my Roomba)! I have a dog and a cat inside, and it picks up all of the hair. It has my home remaining clean, and it's such a help once the floors are mopped and re-vaccumed by my wife. She has had her floor cleaning time cut in half (per her). She loves the extra help. She has it scheduled to clean on certain days, and thanks me often for the purchase. I'm happy when she is happy!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: This is such a great deal for those of us who can't afford a maid!
customer_reviews.text: This is well worth its price. I hate housework, and particularly vacuuming and sweeping, but I have pets who shed, and this is the best purchase I've ever made in terms of helping me with housework. I turn Roomba on when I leave the house, and when I come back, she's either finished vacuuming or is still working. I am going to order one for my daughter. At first, she would get caught on things, but now that she knows her way around, I can turn her on and go out and not have to worry about her getting stuck. It's also really easy to clean out the dust receptacle.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup but the app needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: The device is awesome. It is a little wonky seeing it move about the house and our dogs are terrified but it works great on the hair but for carpet and hardwood. Only issue is the app is not the best, but you can run it without the app.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Decided to splurge on a name brand roomba and take advantage of the amazon monthly payments option. Huge mistake. I’m still paying on a roomba that doesn’t work. It stops halfway through the job and says please charge, or it gets stuck on a small rug. It not won’t charge and can’t dock itself. We tried all the diagnostics and cleaning but it just seems this is a low quality vacuum. We have an off brand one that’s been working for years just fine. Don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Kaley

customer_reviews.title: Everything I never knew I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had wanted one but the price always intimidated me. So I bought it as the Black Friday deal. This is everything I never knew I needed. It does a wonderful job keeping my floors clean. I have 2 inside dogs (one is long haired), 2 small sons and a husband. It doesn’t necessarily “deep clean” but it keeps me from having to “deep clean” every week. I have used it almost everyday since I’ve had it and it amazes me that it cleans for about 2 hours and the dust bin is usually full. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr &Ms.H

customer_reviews.title: This is a needy little robot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Roomba to replace a Shark that had run through a puppy accident. I knew Roomba be the leader of these robo vacs so I went ahead and choose this model based on it's more affordable price point. Unlike my Shark, it has an app & you can either schedule a job daily or just access the app and it will run. It cleans fine, but it's always getting lost or running out of battery begore returning to the base.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Really Helpful
customer_reviews.text: So far we are very happy with it. With two dogs, he fills up the dust bin nearly every single time he runs. It's a substantial amount of hair and dirt that I don't have to pick up myself and it helps us "bridge" the time between using the full strength vacuum. I think it's worth the $200 - especially if you are beginning to consider alternatives like paying for house cleaners. My only "con" is that sometimes he doesn't make it back on the charger (1/5 times probably). I'm OK with that, though. It's no big deal to plop him back on the charger when I get home.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Spittell

customer_reviews.title: Wondeerful little toy
customer_reviews.text: This thing brings to mind the Chad Mitchel TRio's 'Wonderful little toy'. It goes 'zip' when it moves and 'bop' when it stops and 'whirr' when it stands still. Well, it doesn't do all of that, but it does go around my floor and picks up stuff. It also gets lost in a floor plan that is anything more complicated than rectangular, so I can't run it when I am not there. It does save a little effort, but then emptying it's trash bin and clearing the brushes of hair is itself a chore. I am not sure that it saves any effort over a real, portable vacuum cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Motorguy

customer_reviews.title: It cleans better than you
customer_reviews.text: great it gets places that you normally don't sweep or mop it gets under the beds it gets under the couch it gets it all I'm going to order another one I think it's the i7 this time
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bagwell

customer_reviews.title: IRobot
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning this item for a number of reasons. First off, it is very noisy. Secondly, it gets “lost.” Even when placed right in front of its charging station, it bumps around like a drunken fool. Tried multiple locations and it just kept getting lost and losing charge contacts. I would manually place in on its charging station, and it would come off the dock even though not charged. Its suctioning isn’t all that, either. I bought it for the name recognition. After this disappointing experience, I did a more thorough research on these kind of vacuums, and purchased another brand that was top rated on consumer reports.
customer_reviews.author: Farchimp

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: This roomba is ok, just make sure you don’t have any small items or cords on the floor that you don’t want sucked up. I am however upset with how I revived this roomba. I was clearly given a roomba that was returned. Their was hair and string in one of the rotating balls, the plastic part you pull out was already pulled out and the roomba itself had scratches on it. I wouldn’t have minded if I was told I got a pre opened package, but no one said anything and tried to sell this to me as a product that was brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny F

customer_reviews.title: Best gadget I have bought lately.!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Like most people I hate vacuuming. The iRobot allows me to vacuum while sitting or laying down. I am a live alone senior and I like having a clean house, but hate housework. This gadget allows me to have that. I was amazed at how dirty my carpet was after the first cleaning. I let Rambo run until it ran out of power. It ran for 90 minutes the first time and then went to the dock without prompting. That was so cool. I have had it for about 6 weeks and when I let it run now, there is much less hair and dirt. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: harold j

customer_reviews.title: Just keep cords and strings off the floor.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs and they shed and bring in enough sand from outside for 4 dogs. It is a little loud on my tile floors, but i can compare it to a little quiter then my actual vacuum. But if you have a rug it will be more quite. I run it once a day and it does the whole house on one battery charge (1300 s.f) after 2 days using it it caught up to anything I missed prior to having it,and now only have to empty it out every 4 days. I'm extremly happy with it and it is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: James Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Wifi floor cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This is my second roomba, had an Eufy in between roombas as well. Roomba is definitely the superior floor vacuum . Does a much better job cleaning and for the most part not getting stuck however I would think that it would be a little less noisy. It is a nice feature that you can turn it on/off and return to the base with your phone. The app gives you visibility of how long it cleaned and the dirt detection and will also notify you if it gets stuck. All in all, it is great. This is a replacement of my first one because it went through dog poop and ruined it. Dog poop:1 Roomba 0
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell J. Bagger

customer_reviews.title: Less reliable than my previous Ecovacs
customer_reviews.text: I use this in a relatively small space (approximately 500 sqft) with few obstacles, yet it regularly gets hung up in places that my Ecovacs Deebot had no trouble with. The other challenge is that it is not reliable in seating itself properly in the charging station. I would not go with this model Roomba again. Previously I had a Deebot N79 which rarely had issues. I'm regretting not sticking with that line.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: So difficult to connect to the WiFi that I returned it. Spent 90 minutes on the tech support line at iRobot before giving up. They wanted to send the problem to their advanced team and get back to me in a couple of days. I’ll have a different brand robot in those same two days. Went through a crazy number of attempts, reboots, etc with tech support. It is defective or so sensitive it didn’t function.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge after 1month
customer_reviews.text: The product works great until 1 month goes by, it will not charge even when its on the charger. I have cleaned the charging area over and over again and then you have to place an object under the roomba to get the connection and then eventually that doesn't work. I have found this to be the problem that many have with this brand. It doesn't matter that the product is wonderful if it doesn't charge.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Burke

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as a shark Ion and quite noisy
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty noisy and disruptive cleaning experience. It flatters into walls, gets stuck on door jams, tangles up in wires, knocks over pet food bowls. I have to rescue it two or three times every time it cleans and it has no system intelligence to avoid repeating the same mistake it just made. It does clean, but slowly and inefficiently and it'll miss spots while cleaning one spot 5 times over. I've seen the competition at other people's homes and I'd recommend the Shark Ion over this. The shark stops before hitting walls and is much quieter and does a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great, when it runs.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this iRobot cleaner to replace an old (cheaper brand) cleaner, which died after 2 1/2 years. After 2 months, robot began running around in circles, to the right.(Only!) Troubleshooter stated probably was a bad wheel assembly, which I should replace. I did, and I paid for it (dumb) $25. Worked fine. 9/5/2020, "Error 14" (Dust bin assembly) . Troubleshooter said "clean contacts". Did so. No fix. Troubleshooter said next remedy was replacing the dust bin.($35).Should be under warranty-we'll see what happens. A lot of money for spotty performance.
customer_reviews.author: Rumplestiltskin

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Warehouse Steal!
customer_reviews.text: Rating it 5 stars based on first use. Really writing this to comment on Amazon Warehouse. (Will update actual product after we’ve used it a while). I purchased this thru amazon warehouse for $150. I was expecting “fair, with damage” condition but I was ok with that due to it being half price and also... It’s a vacuum cleaner, not a livingroom center piece. The “damage” was to the exterior of the box. The unit does not look like it was ever even opened (so either it’s brand new or someone did a fantastic job cleaning and repackaging it). Very pleased with this purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: MomtherOfDragons

customer_reviews.title: Works well, kind of loud
customer_reviews.text: Does a pretty good job! Cleans a surprising amount, very satisfying to empty it each time. It gets stuck on a plush rug and I once had to cut it out with a scissors. So don’t let it go on things like that. I did purchase over a different brand because it was supposed to be better at plush rugs... but I guess mine are too plush. It’s pretty loud and the dog hates it... though I think likes it better than the regular vacuum! Overall I think it does a good job. Kind of random though and hasn’t found its way “home” yet so I have to bring it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Norton

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother's birthday, because she hates sweeping the ground, but don't think this actually does the job. It cleans the same area over and over and over again, and misses huge chunks. It also dies 7/10 times mid-clean and is unable to make it back to the loading dock, and no one in my family (including the PhDs and engineers) can seem to figure out why. We've only used it about 10 times, but it often seems like too much of a hassle to use it because we have to monitor the direction it goes and then fetch it once it's done cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Lee

customer_reviews.title: It's works good when it works
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this roomba and it worked great until it got to my big area rug. It has black lines on it and every time it encounters them it stops and gives error 6 saying it's on the edge of a cliff. It's basically the cliff sensors on the roomba thinking it's going to fall down stairs. Customer services only solution to this is to block of the room where the issue is. This is a big area of my house and defeats the purpose of having it. I'm contemplating returning it, not sure if it's worth it if I have to vacuum that room anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda G.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a terrible sounds but its part of the family now
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. It really does. It will suck up all the dirt and hair in your house. It makes a terrible noise on carpet though. Like a cat screaming... We returned one thinking it was defective but that wasn't it as the other one does the same. WD-40 this thing up around the spinning thingy and its not as bad. We thought about returning it and getting one that isn't annoying but it quickly became part of our family as the app has you name it. So Frieda stayed with us and does her thing once a day while we are out.
customer_reviews.author: Irkz87

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for more. I was thinking that this vacuum would clean the whole floor in a *somewhat* methodical way. Instead, it just shuffles around aimlessly and totally randomly, passing right by debris as it goes. You can't program it to learn your floorplans. What's even more frustrating is that we have rugs with different colored square patterns. This stupid thing just gets stuck in one tiny square because it mistakes the edges of each color for different "obstacles" and won't cross over the lines. I wish I had spent more money and gotten a better product. I will say that it picks up a lot of dust in the places it suck-cessfully goes. (ha - get it?)
customer_reviews.author: Troi0219

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting all the Cat Hair!
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! Great quality and easy to start using as soon as you take it out of the box. No Assembly needed! It performs like a PRO and we are very satisfied. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Norma Jean Hoogendyk

customer_reviews.title: Love our Roomba
customer_reviews.text: This does a great job of basic floor vacuuming, is easy to operate and to clean out the waste bin. We use it daily, it sweeps up visible dust, but I have to say that we have no pets now nor dirt tracking in on their feet. My first roomba died from that--constant clogging of pet hair and dirt from 3 lab retrievers! This Roomba is really worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: SKG

customer_reviews.title: Fairly dumb bump and turn navigation leaves me unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: This robot uses fairly dumb bump and turn navigation. As a result, it misses spots and frequently can't find the charging base before the battery is exhausted. It works OK but it's not the Jetsonian godsend it's cracked up to be. I regret purchasing this model a bit. I should have bought a more expensive model, which actually maps your house and remembers which rooms it's done. But those models are 2-3 times more expensive. I can't complain too much for the price point but it's not really a great robot. When it comes time to replace it, I'll be mote careful about the type of intelligence the robot has.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Von Zipper

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gadget but not Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I'd have expected a little more, but I do love it! It is a time saver for a working Mom of teens and dogs! It does a good job cleaning and maneuvering around in different areas, but it will stop and state the message "Please move to another area" when it is not done with the area it's cleaning. The updated version detects stairs so you no longer need to stair detection gadget that sits on the floor. Don't forget to name your device! Apparently, we are supposed to, it's "robot etiquette."
customer_reviews.author: Proud Mom

customer_reviews.title: Roomba 675
customer_reviews.text: The first unit stopped running after about 20 minutes. Not sure what the problem was, but Amazon sent a new one right out before we returned the old Roomba. This new unit works super!! I am surprised how well it works. We have found "she" (my wife named it "Florence") does work best if you lock her in a room and let her do her thing. Otherwise, Roomba will wander all over the house until the battery dies which takes over an hour. If "she" is more than about 20-30 feet from the dock when the battery gets low, it does not make it back to the dock for recharge. Overall, it is a cool product!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave, N8LU

customer_reviews.title: 5 quarantined stars
customer_reviews.text: Roomba 675: Love this, esp during quarantine when I've got enough to do/worry about. Suction is great, works on carpet, handwood, rugs. Battery life = approx 2 hrs. Can run at night & didn't wake my child (our bedrooms are on the 1st floor). Not as loud as a conventional stand up. Love the ability to connect to my phone/Alexa. Def check/clean the brush for hair - daughter/I both have long/thick hair. Canister held more dust/dirt than I expected. Makes life easier!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Noisy, won't do kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job cleaning but...unbelievably noisy. Really. I normally have no problem working on line when a vacuum is running but the loud whining made being in the same room very difficult. Also, wouldn't clean the kitchen unless physically carried there, and the kitchen was open floor plan and next to the docking station. We tried a complete reboot but it didn't work. No modem in kitchen, just standard appliances - no smart appliances - and plenty of light. Easy to clean, good cleaning, but returned.
customer_reviews.author: Janis Ian

customer_reviews.title: Picks up well and gets under furniture
customer_reviews.text: I vacuumed my house the day before my Roomba arrived but, I set it up for a trial run and was astounded at the amount of dust and hair it picked up. I should have gotten this a longtime ago. After my back surgery my doctor told me not to vacuum but, I did it anyway and paid the price in back pain. This Roomba is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Get One
customer_reviews.text: The question we ask ourselves whenever this right-sized cleaner is skittering around our floor is, “why did we wait so long to get one?” Our house has never been cleaner and never with so little effort on our part. It is a good idea to de clutter your house of charger cables, shoestrings, loose clothing, etc. before turning any robot vacuum on. A plus is that these vacs scoot under beds and other places that are difficult to access with a conventional upright. Our house is about 1200 sf, if you have a lager house you might want to consider a larger model.
customer_reviews.author: Will VONDAUSTER

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at how much this picks up.
customer_reviews.text: This cleans up so much dust and cat hair. I am very pleased at how well it removes particles from the floor. I bought it to clean under the beds but it works great on the living room carpet. I feel comfortable having the 1 year old twins crawling around after it cleans. Dirt cup is easy to empty and extra filter in nice as I can wash one and use the other. Clean up all the cat toys and wires as this will suck them up along with the dirt. Goes from bare floors to carpet without trouble.
customer_reviews.author: REMECCAN

customer_reviews.title: Useful but has some kinks
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this for a while now. There are things we love about it (Alexa enabled, easy to use phone app, cleans certain areas really well) and there are things that are not so impressive (won't climb to clean a shaggy area rug, has difficulty returning to base, does not come with barriers). We set it to go off daily at specific times which it does but will sometimes get stuck. I am reading that these issues are common with most of these robot vacuums so I shouldn't be too critical, especially for the relatively reasonable price for a name brand compared to others.
customer_reviews.author: Ewiz

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra cost!
customer_reviews.text: First I purchased a slightly cheaper look alike, it couldn't deal with my multicolored/speckled floors and just spun in circles then fell off every ledge. I returned it and paid a bit more for the Roomba. This machine is like a maid in the house who just improved my overall existence ten fold!! No joking. My husband and dogs make every surface, especially floors crumb magnets, this has stopped that (or me noticing) entirely. I should have got this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great! but not 'smart' enough
customer_reviews.text: The goal of purchasing this product is to clean the area underneath the bed and cabinet. It works! however, it does not go the route you want it to go. It misses some spots sometimes, and it repeats going to one spot. Sometimes you have to watch it to make sure it does not knock down your things on the floor(like we have chess on the floor) I would recommend it to people who have children, pets, and busy with work and other stuff, this would be a good help. It does make a fairly loud sound just for anyone who minds it.
customer_reviews.author: Jade wei🌷

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to get one.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’m satisfied with the unit. The only fault it has it won’t vacuum my shaggy rug on top of the carpet. Which isn’t a dealbreaker. I have a large coffee table covering most of it. I do have a hand and shop vac. Thanks to COVID-19 I was able to afford a luxury I didn’t know I needed. It goes over the carpet several times. I can watch tv while its running. It doesn’t scare the rabbit into hiding. I do wished it came with two sweeping arms. But that is just me thinking of more efficiency. I like you can name it and program for auto cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: bc_boy

customer_reviews.title: Efficient dor frequent usage; not deep cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical to use the robotic vaccum but it is pretty effective. Can’t compare with Wet Vaccum for carpets but this is easier for frequent usage and that’s what makes it real efficient. May be newer/ expensive models would work better for deep cleaning but not this one. Still based on the price; can’t complain.
customer_reviews.author: Amruta

customer_reviews.title: Don't neglect cleaning the thing that cleans for you.
customer_reviews.text: I've spoken to a lot of people, all pet owners, who say that they've broken several of these. I can say that this is 100% due to neglect of the device. We have 3 cats and this thing is amazing. Also, my Roomba 675 B2-T2 Droid is cooler than yours! 2 coats flat grey primer 2 coats flat olive drab Olive drab dark wash. Hull red and rust wash. More olive drab. I'll be painting the top of the B2-T2 Droid a lighter shade of green or greenish-yellow, and adding some other details to make this a unique service droid. :) Yes, there are decal kits for these but i prefer to hand paint for weathering effects.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Do your research before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to finally get a Roomba. I bought it used on amazon for an amazing price. Surprising, it was brand new, never used. It does vacuum floors and short pile carpeting, but not regular to high pile carpeting. The most annoying thing about this vacuum (which is very frustrating) is you can not control where it goes. You put it where you want to vacuum and it does it’s own thing. It also will vacuum the same area over and over again and ignore other spots. I use it, but not as much as my shark cordless vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn S.

customer_reviews.title: Works well, amazing price for how it changes life!
customer_reviews.text: Cleans the whole bottom floor of a 2600 sq foot house in a little over an hour. Docks itself back with about 45% battery life. Goes over carpet and hardwood floors. Does not scratch or mark up walls. The only time it got stuck was when I left a cord on the floor. Works with Alexa, as well as the smartphone app.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Its alright..
customer_reviews.text: Its definitely a great vaccum for daily cleaning, especially if you have a shedding dog. Not so great for deep cleaning or picking up. I sweep just as much as when I didn't have it, so honestly not really worth the 200 dollars for it to just pick up dog hair and small lint. Also it gets stuck so many times underneath furniture 🙄 that's pretty aggravating seeing as I cant even have it clean while I'm gone from my home or else I'll immediately get a notification that it got stuck somewhere 🤦🏻‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Daisy Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Great house help and worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this vacuum for some months already, having a dog at home we need cleaning constantly because of the hair and this has been a great help. We use it every other day and although we clean with a big vacuum too, there is always hair and dust in the Roomba after every use. Really worth the money and wish I’d have gotten it before.
customer_reviews.author: T&J Soto

customer_reviews.title: Best new use info for the 675
customer_reviews.text: The 675 does not have a “ home” button...use the spot & dock, hold both down for 10 secs, the release, that reboots, then hold both down 2secs. Done, roomba will tell u are connected... this is a sweeping vacuum, not a sucking type. Let it keep cleaning, looks for dust with the sweeping arm, then turns. I’ve watched mine, it’s just looking for dust, at first , then gets deeper the more you use it..... it took awhile to go down my hallway, but veteran user told me to turn the hallway light on & it worked, darkness works against the sensors...who knew but vet....ha
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this model if you have dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this roomba to replace our 650 and it absolutely sucks and vacuuming up dog hair transitioning from hard wood to any rug at all it will leave a 3-5” boarder or dog hair and you will have to vacuum it up yourself with a stick vacuum every single day. I tried returning the roomba and they offered me $200 towards a new $700 model. Absolute biggest waste of money. Don’t but this if you have dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saves me from having to vacuum.
customer_reviews.text: So after a year and a half the charger stopped connecting to the Roomba and it was completely dead, but I called iRobot's customer support and the rep very easily walked me through a few steps to resolve the issue and promised me a call back in a few hours once the vacuum would have had a chance to charge. Ultimately not giving 5 stars, because this troubleshoot steps should have been in the manual to save the aggravation, and because the vacuum's height keeps getting stuck in a few places in the apartment under furniture which makes it a drag to find and put it back in the dock.
customer_reviews.author: Meems

customer_reviews.title: Effective but noisy
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing! We have a heavy shedding dog, and it’s awesome to be able to run a sweep cycle mid-day and come home to clean floors. The big downside is the noise- it’s pretty loud, so I really only like sending it around when I’m not home. The cycles take about an hour and a half for three medium-sized rooms, which is about all the batter can do. It will not leave your house spotless, but it made a huge difference for us in cutting down on loose bits tracked in by daily in/out activity and dog hair. I would recommend it as long as you’re not hoping to run it while at home.
customer_reviews.author: Carlie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 6 months ago and it has been an absolute nightmare. It is my second Roomba, the first one was great, this one is terrible. I have had to call Customer Service repeatedly, they talk to me like I am am moron and go through the same steps every time. 90% of the time it says Charging Error #1. Which I am told it can't read the battery. I have watched You Tube videos, read blogs and everything in this thing. I give up. I am going to buy another brand and start over.
customer_reviews.author: TODD VO

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: After using this, it is ok for light cleaning but thats it. I would suggest a different brand or style. It does not map and does not do a good job cleaning. It does a mediocre job cleaning. I would not recommend. UPDATE as of 6/15 this thing wont charge. It didnt clean well in the first place and now after 5 moths its junk. Unreal, and then Amazon wont help out either. I am stunned and surprised. Definitely STAY AWAY from this model and Amazon Prime is apparently not worth the protection they claim they give you.
customer_reviews.author: Myk

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not for deep cleaning in my opinion, but it's nice to keep the floors tidy if I don't want to sweep or vacuum every day or even every week. The app is easy to use, and the vacuum is easy to clean My only complaints are the fact that it doesn't go in a straight line or pattern. It moves around quite randomly, which makes me feel like not everything is getting clean. It also tends to get stuck when moving onto thick carpets.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing! We have two catA a dog and kids and she picks up most of the daily mess. It’s not perfect - sometimes she misses a little here or there and we have a thick shag carpet In one room and she doesn’t work on it but for the hard wood, tile and regular carpet she does a surprisingly good job. I also like that when I’m out for a bit I can start it via an app or at home just ask Alexa to start it and we have a daily schedule set up as well. Buy it really is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Sally Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Died After 16 Months...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a single person that runs this twice a week and I clean the filter, wheels & brushes regularly. After 16 months, the motor just quit. I have it programmed to run and the app will say it's cleaning for about three minutes and then it will time out. All the while, the Roomba never came off the dock. It is fully charged and I can hear the chiming that it's going to start cleaning...and then...nothing. Contacted the Customer Service email that Amazon provides...hoping to get a satisfactory resolution. I will update this review to let potential buyers know of the service recovery experience from this company!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel E.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t Live Without!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this product highly enough! We have 3 cats and 1 dog and this keeps the pet hair under control! I love being able to vacuum effortlessly everyday. We have a pretty open floor plan; so that helps it run smoothly. However, you do have to keep things off the floor (small cat toys in our case) that could get caught in the machine. Also, you have to keep cords out if its way. If you start with a clean floor, it keeps it clean; but, you’ll still need to use your regular vacuum occasionally. I love my Roomba and have no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Tava

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this! So easy to use - you download an app and can schedule a cleaning time or start a clean with your phone. Works when out of the home. I have had this product since the fall and only have had to empty it once or twice. I do still use a regular vacuum once in awhile but this product gets the job done! It senses where stairs are and stuff so it can clean without supervision. If it gets stuck somewhere, it makes a noise and sends a notification to your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Well, it doesn't suck completly
customer_reviews.text: Seems to do a pretty fair job of sweeping up hair and that's exactly what it does, sweeps, vacuuming not so much. We end up a lot more dust on furniture but with two German Shepherds and two cats we got hair in abundance. He keeps us from breaking out the real vacuum cleaner to once a week. Good value for what we paid. I bought a high-end Samsung that sucks well but only runs about 15 minutes at a time, this thing runs for an hour to an hour and 15 minutes on a single charge you get tired of watching it
customer_reviews.author: 58Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Its mission is to destroy furniture and do half the house
customer_reviews.text: It seems its mission is to knock over delicate pedestal tables and dent furniture! It goes ramming speed into all furniture and rarely senses it’s near something, gets perpetually hung up under chairs and constantly gets stuck on the step because its edge-detection doesn’t really work. It does good with sucking up pet hair, but with how it damages the furniture I can’t recommend it to anyone, unless you only have cardboard boxes as end tables and beanbag chairs. It also often returns home with only having done one room. Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Good little robot, but does not have floor mapping.
customer_reviews.text: I was fairly pleased with the cleaning ability for our wood floors. It even got into places we normally wouldn't/couldn't vacuum. The only problem with this model is that it does not have floor mapping. After running it a few times, it was easy to see that that is a necessary function when you have a large or complex floorplan. It is just too random, cleaning some spots over and over and leaving others. Also, it also finds its way back to the base by the same method, so 9 times out of 10, it will run out of battery, stranded somewhere in the house. I returned this model and ordered the Roomba 960, which has the floor mapping software.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Expect to be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Worked for one day.. Tried it out for three days.. day one it worked great. Day two it got stuck on a rug that does not have high pile carpet In fact it’s a entry way rug but it still got stuck and died. Day three it died after 20 mins of cleaning after it had been charging all night and morning. Now it won’t charge. Returning it. Very disappointed. Can’t tell if it’s even docked because there is no indication of it being docked. Ugh.. I had high expectations. Guess I’ll try a newer model.
customer_reviews.author: kthorn

customer_reviews.title: Not convenient
customer_reviews.text: Was not impressed at all!! I bought these to helo clean up after my kids after they eat.....after over a hour of traveling around the house it never got to the spot where I was wanting it to clean up. It would of been easier and faster to just grab a broom and on myself and do it! Needless to say...it was returned!!
customer_reviews.author: Sindy

customer_reviews.title: Love my Roomba!
customer_reviews.text: Rosie the Roomba does a great job picking up my hair (which is very long) as well as my two cats' hair. Much easier to just prep the house (pick up loose things on the floor, move some furniture around) and start Rosie than to vacuum--which forces my teenager to pick up her room! Also helped us take control of the flea problem we were having. Connects to the app and lets you know when she's stuck, low on battery, or done with the job (and she returns to her dock to recharge). Easy to empty bin (just remember to do it every time as it's not very big). Very happy we finally got her!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy in FL

customer_reviews.title: Easy and very effective!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how I lived without this Rumba! I have arthritis and scoliosis and it is so difficult to vacuum and it always made me hurt so I put off vacuuming! I have two dogs who shed so it is imperative that my house gets vacuumed often! Now I just push the button and let it go! I do a room or two per day. It is easy to dump the debris and clean the filter! It does an excellent job and I was skeptical at first because it seemed so random but that doesn’t matter, it gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie M. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Roomba will change your life!  This is a must have!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t be more pleased! I’ve considered purchasing this product for a while but was hesitant because I couldn’t believe that a little tiny vacuum would be efficient. The IRobot Roomba is life changing! I have it programmed to vacuum at 3pm and I come home to clean floors every day! It works well on my hardwood floors as well as carpet. It requires little maintenance and my floors look amazing. I have already sold about seven of them to my friends and family because they can see how fantastic my floor look! It even goes under my bed and dressers! It cuts down on the amount of dust in the house too. Did I mention I LOVE my Roomba??
customer_reviews.author: Kim Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Invaluable!
customer_reviews.text: She does a great job. We call her Rosie. She can get stuck in tricky spots - like my walk in pantry. I just make sure door to pantry is closed. Other than that she really keeps the hair and dust to a minimum. Occasionally her battery dies before she finds her way back home but that is not a big deal. I have all hard wood floors and would have to dust mop every other day. I will never go without Rosie again! Love her so much I put her in my basement and got another- Rosie 2 for main floor.
customer_reviews.author: alice moran-tilles

customer_reviews.title: My Roomba is FANTASTIC!!!
customer_reviews.text: My new iRobot Roomba arrived yesterday afternoon and I set it to clean for about 15 minutes while I was walking my dog. It's AMAZING how much dog hair that machine picked up. I live in a studio apartment and there is always some dog hair and bits of sand (we live near the beach) under the couch and tables. I vacuumed a few days ago and thought I had done a decent job until I opened the dustbin on my Roomba. I am so happy that I purchased this Roomba and am looking forward to years of use. I highly recommend it to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy C.

customer_reviews.title: Gets easily clogged and the parts are cheap and breakable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this since December. I find myself constantly cleaning its workings, and it seems to be designed so that dirt spreads all over its insides. I was trying to replace the side brush today and the screw snapped off - it seems to be made of the cheapest softest metal imaginable. I called Customer Service but they are unavailable, although I called within their posted hours. Similarly, their online chat service was not working. Sigh.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Great for floors
customer_reviews.text: The first Roomba had problems so I exchanged it. This one is operationally sound. I have to keep an eye on it & help it get through a room. It can slip under furniture like my china cabinet & that’s a problem. I have pets and it’s good at picking up the hair from carpets. It does not run on my plush throw rug. I love it for the bathroom & kitchen floors. My pets think it’s a new member of the family. I’m pleased with the purchase but will still need to drag out the vacuum cleaner for a deeper cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

product_meta.title: iRobot Roomba 675 Robot Vacuum-Wi-Fi Connectivity, Works with Alexa, Good for Pet Hair, Carpets, Hard Floors, Self-Charging
product_meta.description: Style Name:Roomba 675Connect to clean from anywhere with the Roomba 675 robot vacuum. The patented 3-Stage Cleaning System is specially engineered to loosen, lift, and suction everything from small particles to large debris from carpets and hard floors. Just press Clean or schedule Roomba on the go with the iRobot HOME App.
feature_bullets: CLEAN SMARTER - The 600 series is a great way to begin cleaning your home smarter. Just schedule it to clean up daily dirt, dust, and debris with the iRobot HOME app or your voice assistant. - for effortlessly clean floors.
LOOSENS, LIFTS, & SUCTIONS - The 3 Stage Cleaning system & Dual Multi-Surface brushes grab dirt from carpets & hard floors, an Edge-Sweeping brush takes care of corners & edges.
LEARNS YOUR LIFE LISTENS TO YOUR VOICE - Learns your cleaning habits to offer up personalized schedules, while Google Assistant & Alexa allow you to start cleaning with just the sound of your voice.
ADAPTIVE NAVIGATION - A full suite of advanced sensors allow Roomba to navigate under & around furniture, & along edges. Cliff Detect keeps it from falling down stairs.
SENSES & ELIMINATES DIRT - Dirt Detect Sensors alert your robot about dirtier areas of your home, like high-traffic spots, & cleans them more thoroughly.
CLEAN FLOORS EVERYDAY - Provides a system of cleaning features & smart sensors that allow the robot to adjust to your unique home & deliver a daily clean.
CLEANS CARPETS & HARD FLOORS - Auto-Adjust Cleaning Head automatically adapts its height to effectively clean carpets & hard floors.
AUTOMATICALLY RECHARGES - Runs for up to 90 minutes before automatically docking & recharging.

iRobot does not certify the quality or authenticity of products purchased from non-authorized resellers, & will not cover claims, provide service or offer replacements for products purchased from these sellers.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars14,425 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Owner’s Guide, 1 Home Base® Charging Station, 1 North American Line Cord, Documentation Package, 1 Roomba® 675 Robot Vacuum with Wi-Fi® Connectivity
